Package edu.bu.pas.pacman.interfaces

Interface ThriftyPelletEater

public interface ThriftyPelletEater
A class to represent an entity that seeks to eat all the pellets in a pacman maze as quickly as possible. This entity has to search through a graph whose vertices contain a collection of the remaining pellets. Two vertices share a directed edge if the destination vertex's pellet collection is only missing one pellet that the source vertex's collection contains (because that pellet was eaten). The cost of this edge should be some lower-bound on the shortest path to get from pacman's current location to the food pellet that was eaten in the destination state. In order to implement this interface, one must override a neighborhood method (for generating the graph), an edge weight method (to calculate the edge weight between two vertices), a heuristic method (used for A* planning), and a control method used to calculate the shortest path.
See Also:
  • PelletGraph.PelletVertex
  • Path

  • Method Details

    • getOutoingNeighbors

      Set<PelletGraph.PelletVertex> getOutoingNeighbors(PelletGraph.PelletVertex vertex, Game.GameView game)
      A method for calculating the neighborhood of a PelletGraph.PelletVertex. This method defines the graph that the ThriftyPelletEater must traverse looking for the shortest path.
      Parameters:
      vertex - A PelletGraph.PelletVertex object to get the outgoing neighborhood of.
      game - A Game.GameView object representing the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      The set of vertices reachable via a direct outgoing edge from the input vertex.

    • getEdgeWeight

      float getEdgeWeight(PelletGraph.PelletVertex src, PelletGraph.PelletVertex dst)
      A method to calculate the edge weight between two PelletGraph.PelletVertex objects. This edge weight should be some lower bound on the shortest path cost between the two locations (the location of pacman in the src and the location of pacman in the dst). In the dst PelletGraph.PelletVertex, pacman's location should be the location of the newly-eaten food pellet (that is missing in dst but present in src).
      Parameters:
      src - A PelletGraph.PelletVertex object representing the source of a directed edge.
      dst - A PelletGraph.PelletVertex object representing the destination of the directed edge.
      Returns:
      The weight of the directed edge to go from src to dst.

    • getHeuristic

      float getHeuristic(PelletGraph.PelletVertex src, Game.GameView game)
      Parameters:
      src - A PelletGraph.PelletVertex object representing a vertex of the pellet graph.
      game - A Game.GameView object representing the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      The heuristic value guessing the path cost of going from src to a goal state.

    • findPathToEatAllPelletsTheFastest

      Path<PelletGraph.PelletVertex> findPathToEatAllPelletsTheFastest(Game.GameView game)
      A method to calculate the shortest path pacman has to travel in order to eat all of the food pellets remaining in the current state of the game. This path tells pacman the order to eat the pellets. Once this order is known, you can issue commands to pacman to actually route pacman between pellets on the map.
      Parameters:
      game - A Game.GameView object representing the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      The shortest path to eat all of the pellets remaining in the current state of the game.
